Cumulative effect over the following year when a 1°C increase occurs in country-months with a temperature of 25°C, under the central specification in column 1 of Supplementary Tables S4 & S5 and Fig. 1a.  This represents the inflationary effect over 12 months following an initial temperature shock, assumed for illustrative purposes to be in the following year after the data horizon.
The result assumes persistent upward pressures on food inflation.

Estimate based on pressures from advanced economies.

Impacts are estimated accounting only for increasing average temperatures using the baseline empirical specification shown in column 1 of Supplementary Tables S4 & S5. Estimates reflect the exogenous pressure on inflation arising from future weather conditions in the absence of historically un-precedented adaptation, policy response, and abstracting from any possible interactions with macroeconomic developments. Value is set to 0 as there is no specific number mentioned in the text.
